item.title: 独家报道消息人士称英伟达在华为芯片之争中下调中国价格
item.description: 据熟悉内情的消息人士透露，英伟达为中国市场开发的最先进人工智能芯片起步不利，充足的供应迫使其定价低于中国科技巨头华为的竞争对手芯片。【原文：Nvidia's most advanced AI chip it developed for the China market has got off to a weak start, with abundant supply forcing it to be priced below a rival chip from Chinese tech giant Huawei, according to sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，克里斯汀-约翰逊成为美国联邦存款保险公司新任主席的主要候选人
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引一位知情人士的话报道，商品期货交易委员会民主党委员克里斯汀-约翰逊（Kristin Johnson）已成为领导联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）的主要候选人。【原文：Kristin Johnson, a Democratic commissioner at the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, has emerged as a leading candidate to lead the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp (FDIC), Bloomberg News reported on Thursday citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亚洲股市下跌，美元上涨，降息赌注动摇
item.description: 周五，亚洲股市下跌，美元走高，原因是强劲的美国经济数据增强了利率在更长时间内保持较高水平的前景，以及美联储将慢慢削减利率，使投资者远离风险资产。【原文：Asian stocks fell on Friday, while the dollar advanced as strong U.S. economic data bolstered the prospect of interest rates staying higher for longer and the Federal Reserve taking its time in cutting rates, keeping investors away from risky assets.】

item.title: 降息押注消退，美元将迎来周涨势
item.description: 周五，美元创下一个半月以来的最大单周涨幅，这主要得益于出人意料的强劲美国经济指标和美联储会议纪要的鹰派基调。【原文：The dollar headed for its largest weekly rise in a month and a half on Friday, helped by surprisingly strong U.S. economic indicators and a hawkish tone in Federal Reserve minutes.】

item.title: 美国汽油需求坚挺，抵消了对利率的担忧，石油价格持平
item.description: 周五盘初，油价持稳，原因是在通胀持续高企的情况下，市场人士对美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）关于利率的最新评论进行了评估，而美国季节性燃料需求的坚挺也为油价提供了支撑。【原文：Oil prices were steady early in the session on Friday as players took stock of the U.S. Federal Reserve's latest comments on interest rates amid sticky inflation, while firming seasonal U.S. fuel demand lent support.】

item.title: 美光在 Netlist 专利案中被判赔 4.45 亿美元
item.description: 美国一个陪审团周四表示，芯片制造商美光科技欠计算机内存公司 Netlist 4.45 亿美元的赔偿金，因为美光侵犯了 Netlist 在高性能计算内存模块技术方面的专利权。【原文：Chipmaker Micron Technology owes computer-memory company Netlist $445 million in damages for violating Netlist's patent rights in memory-module technology for high-performance computing, a U.S. jury said on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本 4 月通胀率进一步放缓至 2.2%，符合预期
item.description: 日本政府周五公布的数据显示，由于食品通胀较为温和，4月份日本核心通胀率连续第二个月放缓，但仍远高于央行设定的2%的目标。【原文：Japan's core inflation slowed for a second straight month in April due to milder food inflation while staying comfortably above the central bank's 2% target, government data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 美股变动将外汇交易推向亚洲 "黄昏地带
item.description: 下周美股交割窗口的缩短预计将扰乱亚洲资金经理的交易，促使一些人在货币市场最稀薄、最不稳定的凌晨时分确保资金安全。【原文：A shortening of U.S. stock settlement window next week is expected to upend trading for Asian money managers, pushing some to secure funds in the early hours of their mornings when currency markets are at their thinnest and most jumpy.】

item.title: 解读：中国最新的房地产市场支持方案--其内容和利害关系
item.description: 中国上周宣布采取 "历史性 "措施，稳定受危机冲击的房地产行业，旨在清理库存，刺激购房需求。【原文：China announced "historic" steps last week to stabilise its crisis-hit property sector, aiming to clear inventory and boost homebuyer demand.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称三星 HBM 芯片因发热和功耗问题未能通过 Nvidia 测试
item.description: 三位知情人士称，由于发热和功耗问题，三星电子最新的高带宽内存（HBM）芯片尚未通过英伟达（Nvidia）的测试，无法用于这家美国公司的人工智能处理器。【原文：Samsung Electronics' latest high bandwidth memory (HBM) chips have yet to pass Nvidia's tests for use in the U.S. firm's AI processors due to heat and power consumption problems, three people briefed on the issues said.】

item.title: 波音公司更新制造和质量部门新员工的培训内容
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，该飞机制造商在二月下旬暂停了对制造和质量部门新员工的培训后，已经更新了培训内容。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday the planemaker has updated its workforce training for new hires for manufacturing and quality after pausing it in late February.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，SpaceX 正酝酿以 2,000 亿美元的估值进行要约收购
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）已开始讨论出售现有股份的交易，该交易可能使该公司的估值达到约 2,000 亿美元。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX has initiated discussions about selling existing shares in a deal that could value the company at roughly $200 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯董事会批准将部分钢铁业务出售给亿万富翁克里廷斯基
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯公司周四表示，面对劳工代表的持续反对，公司监事会批准了向捷克亿万富翁丹尼尔-克雷廷斯基（Daniel Kretinsky）出售该集团钢铁部门 20% 股份的计划。【原文：Thyssenkrupp on Thursday said its supervisory board approved a planned sale of 20% of the conglomerate's steel division to Czech billionaire Daniel Kretinsky in the face of continued opposition from labour representatives.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，汉堡王将先于麦当劳推出 5 美元超值套餐
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引一份备忘录报道，餐饮品牌国际公司（Restaurant Brands International）旗下的汉堡王（Burger King）正在抢在麦当劳之前推出自己的 5 美元套餐。【原文：Restaurant Brands International-owned Burger King is launching its own $5 meal deal ahead of McDonald's , Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing a memo.】

item.title: DoubleLine 首席执行官预计美国经济即将衰退，政府债务激增
item.description: 投资管理公司双线资本（DoubleLine Capital）首席执行官杰弗里-冈德拉克（Jeffrey Gundlach）周四表示，由于利率上升给美国消费者和企业带来压力，他预计美国最快将在今年出现经济衰退。【原文：Jeffrey Gundlach, the chief executive of investment management company DoubleLine Capital, expects a U.S. recession as soon as this year, he said on Thursday, as higher interest rates pressure U.S. consumers and companies.】

item.title: 摩根大通将为违规交易报告支付 1 亿美元
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会周四表示，摩根大通公司将为交易报告失误支付 1 亿美元。【原文：The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Thursday said JPMorgan Chase & Co will pay $100 million over trade reporting lapses.】

item.title: 亚洲市场降温，日本将出现通胀
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 派拉蒙与 Charter Communications 签署新的内容发行协议
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）周四表示，该公司已与 Charter Communications 公司就其全部线性有线电视网络产品组合签署了一份新的多年内容发行协议。【原文：Paramount Global has signed a new multi-year content distribution deal with Charter Communications for its full portfolio of linear cable networks, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 报告发现 FTX 破产案律师并非欺诈同谋
item.description: FTX 的破产律师沙利文-克伦威尔公司（Sullivan & Cromwell）没有参与导致这家加密货币公司倒闭的欺诈行为，法院指定的审查员周四得出了这样的结论。【原文：FTX's bankruptcy lawyers at Sullivan & Cromwell were not complicit in the fraud that caused the crypto company to collapse, a court-appointed examiner concluded on Thursday.】

item.title: 解说：美国音乐会门票为何如此昂贵
item.description: 美国司法部周四起诉解散 Live Nation Entertainment 公司，称这家大型演唱会推广商及其 Ticketmaster 部门非法抬高演唱会票价，损害了艺术家及其粉丝的利益。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department on Thursday sued to break up Live Nation Entertainment , saying the big concert promoter and its Ticketmaster unit illegally inflated concert ticket prices, hurting artists and their fans.】

item.title: 消息人士称，高盛获得在沙特阿拉伯设立地区总部的许可
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，华尔街巨头高盛（Goldman Sachs）已获得在沙特阿拉伯利雅得设立地区总部的许可。【原文：Wall Street titan Goldman Sachs has received a license to set up its regional headquarters in Saudi Arabia's Riyadh, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会批准交易所上市现货以太坊 ETF 的申请
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周四批准了纳斯达克（Nasdaq）、芝加哥商业交易所（CBOE）和纽约证券交易所（NYSE）关于上市与以太坊价格挂钩的交易所交易基金（ETF）的申请，为这些产品在今年晚些时候开始交易铺平了道路。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday approved applications from Nasdaq, CBOE and NYSE to list exchange-traded funds (ETFs) tied to the price of ether, potentially paving the way for the products to begin trading later this year.】

item.title: 消息人士称，俄罗斯 Nornickel 公司计划在巴林建造一座 PGMs 提炼厂
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周四告诉路透社，俄罗斯金属巨头 Nornickel 公司计划在巴林联合建设一个铂族金属（PGMs）精炼厂项目。【原文：Russian metals giant Nornickel plans a joint project for construction of a platinum group metals (PGMs) refinery in Bahrain, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克称美国尚未过通胀 "担忧点
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周四表示，美联储可能需要等待更长的时间才能降息，因为即使四月份的通胀数据略微降温，物价仍有继续上涨的压力。【原文：The Federal Reserve may need to wait longer to cut interest rates because even with April's slightly cooler inflation reading there is continued upward pressure on prices, Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic said on Thursday.】

item.title: 因折扣产品需求稳定，罗斯百货季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 罗斯百货公司（Ross Stores）周四公布的第一季度财报高于华尔街预期，并上调了全年利润预期，原因是通胀高企挤压了购物者的预算，促使他们转向非价格零售商。【原文：Ross Stores on Thursday posted first-quarter results above Wall Street estimates and raised its annual profit forecast, as shoppers pivot to off-price retailers prompted by sticky inflation that have squeezed their budgets.】

item.title: 道琼斯指数：英伟达分拆飙升股票可能增强对散户投资者的吸引力
item.description: 在芯片制造商 Nvidia 的股价出现惊人上涨之后，该公司的股票分拆计划可能会吸引更多散户投资者的兴趣，同时有可能为该公司加入道琼斯工业平均指数铺平道路。【原文：Nvidia's plan to split its stock after the stunning rise in the chipmaker's share price could lure more interest from retail investors while potentially paving the way for the company's inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，CVS 寻求投资者为橡树街健康公司的发展提供资金
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，CVS Health Corp 一直在寻求私募股权合作伙伴，为其一年前收购的初级保健提供商 Oak Street Health 的发展提供资金。【原文：CVS Health Corp has been seeking a private equity partner to fund growth at Oak Street Health, a primary care provider it bought a year ago, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 标准普尔分析师称波音现金流状况不如预期
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司的一位分析师说，波音公司的现金流状况比他们的预期越来越差，此前该公司曾表示 2024 年将出现负现金流。【原文：Boeing's cash flow situation is incrementally worse than their expectations, an S&P Global Ratings analyst said, after the company said it would be cash-flow negative in 2024.】

item.title: 赫斯-雪佛龙合并案投票时机似乎已成熟，将以微弱优势获得批准
item.description: 赫斯公司（Hess Corp）首席执行官约翰-赫斯（John Hess）必须在本周二之前平息股东对他处理可能成为石油行业历史上最大兼并案之一的处理方式的不满：拟以 530 亿美元的价格将这家石油生产商出售给雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：Hess Corp CEO John Hess has until Tuesday to quell a rebellion by shareholders over his handling of what could turn out to be one of the largest mergers in oil industry history: a proposed $53 billion sale of the oil producer to Chevron Corp .】

item.title: 美国公司最大的一些分裂
item.description: 化学制造商杜邦公司宣布了一项将公司拆分为三家上市公司的计划，成为最新一家拆分业务的跨国公司。【原文：Chemical maker DuPont has become the latest multinational to break up its business, announcing a plan to split the firm into three publicly traded companies.】
